commit.message:
Remove deprecated license_file from setup.cfg (#182)

Starting with wheel 0.32.0 (2018-09-29), the "license_file" option is
deprecated.

https://wheel.readthedocs.io/en/stable/news.html

The wheel will continue to include LICENSE, it is now included
automatically:

https://wheel.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user_guide.html#including-license-files-in-the-generated-wheel-file
Workaround for distutils bug in python 2.7 (#165)

Drop support for end-of-life Python 3.4 (#181)

Python 3.4 went EOL on 2019-03-18. For additional details, see:

https://devguide.python.org/devcycle/#end-of-life-branches

Test Python 3.7 and 3.8 and document support (#175)

Document that PyPy is also supported.

Support pytest 4, don't apply marks directly to parameters (#174)

Fixes https://github.com/chardet/chardet/issues/173

Typo fix (#159)

Bulgairan -> Bulgarian

Update pypi.python.org URL to pypi.org (#155)

For details on the new PyPI, see the blog post:

https://pythoninsider.blogspot.ca/2018/04/new-pypi-launched-legacy-pypi-shutting.html

Pass python_requires argument to setuptools (#150)

Helps pip decide what version of the library to install.

https://packaging.python.org/tutorials/distributing-packages/#python-requires

> If your project only runs on certain Python versions, setting the
> python_requires argument to the appropriate PEP 440 version specifier
> string will prevent pip from installing the project on other Python
> versions.

https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/setuptools.html#new-and-changed-setup-keywords

> python_requires
>
> A string corresponding to a version specifier (as defined in PEP 440)
> for the Python version, used to specify the Requires-Python defined in
> PEP 345.

Doc the chardet package suitable for production (#144)

No longer considered "beta".

Remove unused coverage configuration (#142)

Last use removed in 1f1cf1ced1b2c6ee67fc9c0fe455f3785f0a7b96.

Drop support for Python 2.6 (#143)

Python 2.6 and 3.3 is EOL and is no longer receiving bug fixes,
including security fixes.

https://snarky.ca/stop-using-python-2-6/
http://www.curiousefficiency.org/posts/2015/04/stop-supporting-python26.html

Fixes #133

Merge pull request #141 from jdufresne/wheel-license

Include license file in the generated wheel package

Include license file in the generated wheel package

The wheel package format supports including the license file. This is
done using the [metadata] section in the setup.cfg file. For additional
information on this feature, see:

https://wheel.readthedocs.io/en/stable/index.html#including-the-license-in-the-generated-wheel-file
Simplify timing steps in bench.py
Fix miscalculation in bench.py
Add more info and options to bench.py
add benchmark script
Bump version to 4.0.0
Make sure pyc files are not in tarballs

Add API option to get all the encodings confidence #96 (#111)

* Add API option to get all the encodings confidence #96

* make code more straightforward

by treating the self.done = True as a real finish point of the analysis

* use detect_all instead of detect(.., all=True)

* fix corner case of when there is no good prober

Convert single-byte charset probers to use nested dicts for language models (#121)

* Convert single byte charset modules to use dicts of dicts for language modules

- Also provide conversion script

* Fix debug logging check

* Keep Hungarian commented out until we retrain
Bump version to 3.0.4
Merge branch 'master' into stable
Merge branch 'master' (early part) into stable
Merge branch 'master' (early part) into stable

Replace broken downloads badge with version badge

Accidentally removed the wrong one in last commit. This is what I get for committing straight to `master`.

Remove broken downloads badge

PyPI doesn't report stats anymore.

Prefer readthedocs.io over readthedocs.org (#129)

Projects should now use readthedocs.io instead of readthedocs.org. Fixed
links to use https.

Bring documentation of Python versions in line with Travis CI test matrix (#130)

Python 3.0, 3.1, 3.2 are not included in the test matrix and so should
not be documented as supported.
Merge branch 'stable'
